multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: commodities; the new Power of Siberia 2 pipeline will increase Russian gas flows to China, potentially lowering Chinese gas prices and shifting global LNG/gas supply dynamics.

category.motivation: The article reports Gazprom signing a legally binding agreement to build a pipeline to China, which is a company-level development not related to earnings.

article_node.title: Xi, Putin Tighten Ties in Beijing With Apparent Gas Breakthrough
article_node.summary: Gazprom has signed a legally binding agreement to build the Power of Siberia 2 pipeline to China via Mongolia, potentially delivering up to 50 billion cubic metres of gas per year for 30 years. The announcement came amid a high‑level meeting between Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin, signalling a tightening of Russia‑China ties. China remains cautious, but the deal could secure lower gas prices for Beijing compared to European rates.
